description: Number of distinct quadratic residues mod 3^n.
comments: Number of distinct n-digit suffixes of base 3 squares.In general, for any odd prime p>=3, the number s of quadratic residues mod p^n is given by s=(p^(n+1) + p + 2)/2*(p+1) for even n and s=(p^(n+1) + 2*p + 1)/2*(p+1) for odd n. - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jan 07 2005
